name: vim
description:
Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to enable efficient text
editing. It is an improved version of the vi editor distributed with
most UNIX systems. Vim is often called a "programmer's editor," and so
useful for programming that many consider it an entire IDE. It's not
just for programmers, though. Vim is perfect for all kinds of text
editing, from composing email to editing configuration files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: findutils
dependencies.description:
The GNU Find Utilities are the basic directory searching utilities of
the GNU operating system.

dependencies.name: ncurses
dependencies.description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses
in System V Release 4.0, and more. It uses terminfo format, supports
pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and
function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements
over BSD curses.

dependencies.name: cscope
dependencies.description: Cscope is a developer's tool for browsing source code.

dependencies.name: lua
dependencies.description: The Lua programming language interpreter and library.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: ruby
dependencies.description:
A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity
and productivity.

dependencies.name: fontconfig
dependencies.description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependencies.name: libxpm
dependencies.description: libXpm - X Pixmap (XPM) image file format library.

dependencies.name: libxtst
dependencies.description:
libXtst provides the Xlib-based client API for the XTEST & RECORD
extensions. The XTEST extension is a minimal set of client and server
extensions required to completely test the X11 server with no user
intervention. This extension is not intended to support general
journaling and playback of user actions. The RECORD extension supports
the recording and reporting of all core X protocol and arbitrary X
extension protocol.

dependencies.name: gtkplus
dependencies.description:
The GTK+ package contains libraries used for creating graphical user
interfaces for applications.
